message.body: $TSLA Ahead of Tesla  third-quarter results, Baird analyst Ben Kallo said he'd buy the shares on any weakness https://www.benzinga.com/analyst-ratings/analyst-color/17/10/10227121/wary-of-what-teslas-q3-will-hold-this-analyst-says-buy-

links.title: Buy Tesla (NASDAQ:TSLA) On Any Weakness
links.description: Ahead of Tesla Inc (NASDAQ: TSLA)'s third-quarter results, Baird analyst Ben Kallo said he'd buy the shares on any weakness. Though cautious into the quarter, Baird remains a long-term buyer, Kallo said in a Wednesday note. Tesla is scheduled to release its results after the market close Wednesday, Nov. 1.

links.title: Tesla Cuts Model 3 Orders From Core Supplier By 40 Percent
links.description: Just days after the Shanghai government was stunned to read in the WSJ that it had granted Tesla permission to open a new gigafactory in its free-trade zone (turns out the two are only in the negotiations stage), according to Taiwanese media reports one of Tesla's largest suppliers in the country has been instructed to pare back production on parts for the Tesla Model 3 - the latest sign that the cash-burning Silicon Valley carmaker is going to miss its goal of producing 5,000 cars a week by December.

links.title: GM Stops Taking Bolt EV Orders in Europe as It Can't Match Demand
links.description: The Chevrolet Bolt electric hatchback has been received very well by both the media and the public since its launch almost one year ago. Its strong point is undoubtedly the 238-mile range, but General Motors has managed to produce an overall great package that only has a few real drawbacks.

links.title: As Tesla Races to Grow, Quality Control Problems Follow
links.description: When you spend six figures or so on a car, you expect the exceptional fit and finish of a luxury vehicle, not to mention solid construction. No one's going to blame you for griping about wood trim that doesn't match, suspension components that rattle, air conditioning that doesn't work, a cracked windshield pillar, a car that unexpectedly shuts down, or the myriad other issues Tesla owners have reported.

Is The $136 Billion Debt Of General Electric A Deterrent? - $GE $HON $AMZN $TSLA $ABB http://bit.ly/GE-Debt

links.title: Is The $136 Billion Debt Of General Electric A Deterrent?
links.description: When running scans on free cash flow yield, I noticed General Electric Company (NYSE: GE) back in Q2 of 2016 to have a confusing outlook. Why would a company with negative free cash flow/FCF be so loved, pumped and even continue to offer the dividend while cash reserves depleted?
